review_content: I had gingivitis and suffered from oral plaque and gum problem. Once I visited a famous local dentist for scaling (One who has gingivitis needs to do it every year  to keep plauque away). He advised me Colgate Total. He told me it has been observed that while an ordinary toothpaste's action lasts for a few minutes, Colgate Total's lasts longer. Till then (3-4 years back) I've been using it. It has effectively reduced my plaque though it's not a medicated toothpaste and now I dodn't need to go to a dentist for scaling every year. My gum problem (Bleeding etc which was related to plaque) is also reduced drastically. It has a strong fluoride taste and produces a lot of foam. the paste also looks contemporary with green stirpes on it's white body. This product earlier was so high in demand that many a time I had to struggle to get it from retail market. All this without much advertising in media. It still enjoys great demand but now Colgate has fixed the supply issue. It's available everywhere with more pack sizes. I recommend it to everyone sharing the same problem.

It makes me happy, it makes my Dentist happy (...well at least I don't have to pay him for anything more than regular cleanings- so maybe he's not happy in the financial sense but I feel in my heart that he feels professionally bolstered by his success at this particular patient having good oral health...!), and I don't feel such trepidation when I visit him every six months.
Overall, this is a pretty good toothpaste. It gets the job done. It's not one of those ''I have to have this toothpaste and only this one''. But it works.
review_tite: Colgate Total toothpaste is here to stay.

Colgate is one of the oldest brands Indians have been using for years now and one will find this toothpaste in every second household of India. But has anyone ever analysed or questioned whether this toothpaste is effective for removing plague and preventing cavities.My family has been using this toothpaste since I was a child and to review a product like toothpaste, it takes a long time usage experience as its results cannot be seen instantly. Teeth damage is seen over a long period of time and not in a day or two. The role of a toothpaste is to either prolong this period further or atleast not allow plague( yellow coloured layer) to connect on the teeth. And I am actually disappointed by this toothpaste as it was never successful in removing the plague and hence spoil the condition of teeth over time. I am disappointed with Colgate Anticavity toothpaste because of following reasons: 1- It does not remove or prevent plague from growing between the teeth even after brushing twice a day for years.2- It thus produces cavities in the teeth and spoils oral health.3- My mother and I had both got a RCT( Root Canal Treatment) each in one of our tooth.4- The company spends large amount of money in its Advertisements every year but very less on research and development of a quality toothpaste.5- The claims made in its Advertisements are very far from reality as they show dentists approving the quality of the toothpaste to be the best, but has anyone ever thought that those dentists are real one's or mere actors? 6- Heavy advertisements over years on different media had inculcated the name of the brand in people's minds.7- Hence, people when going for buying a toothpaste use Colgate as a synonym for a Toothpaste and they ask the shopkeeper, Whether he can get a Colgate.I would suggest people to be aware of these facts and then buy these kind of products on the basis of their experiences. Not to blind trust those attractive Advertisements.
& I am happy with colgate . I suggest all they can use colgate and keep their teeths healthy .

Colgate is an American toothpaste brand which is sold worldwide. It is a brand owned by the company "Colgate Palmolive" which was founded in the year 1806 by "William Colgate". Over 2 centuries this brand is used in all most every house all over the world. Today there are many toothpaste brands invented by Colgate. Colgate MaxFresh is on such brand which provides high action of cooling crystals over the teeth and the gums so that they can stay fresh and healthy. The down side of these cooling crystals is that they can help trigger throat infection, leading to sour throat. This Toothpaste does not suit many people. Also due to the tremendous cooling provided by these cooling crystals, pain in the teeth gums may also occur. To people who have sensitive teeth, I do not recommend this toothpaste, but others can give Colgate MaxFresh a try.

I recently conducted an experiment in my Biology Lab class in college, testing the effectiveness of certain products at inhibiting bacterial growth.  In our results, we concluded that Pepsodent toothpaste only killed or inhibited 50% of the bacteria.  Shockingly, Lysol was even worse, which is what we used to clean the area after the experiment. But that's another issue.  In other words, you might want to use Scope (which killed 88% of bacteria) every time if you decide to continue to use pepsodent toothpaste.  And by the way, Soft Soap brand antibacterial hand soap works exceptionally well at killing bacteria, so I suggest the use of it in every home!
If you are not using Pepsodent, chances are that you would make a new friend, probably, he is a dentist too.

As a dental professional I always tell my Pepsodent users to please stop using it. This is a very abrasive toothpaste and I have had numerous patients with problems associated with it. Please use with care. If you start to notice more sensitivity to cold sensation I would discontinue it immediately. I would suggest a non-whitening toothpaste. Whitening toothpastes will not change the color of your teeth. They may remove slight surface stain, but the overall shade of your teeth will not change. On a related matter, most tartar control toothpastes do not remove tartar below the gum line, only above the gum line. It is the deposit below the gum line that causes more problems for our oral health. These tartar control toothpastes are sometimes quite abrasive as well.  But, always check with your dental professional, as to what is best for you
It's all right for now.  As soon as we're through with this tube, though, we're going to go back to a stronger, more reputable brand.

review_content: Well, I have used Glister toothpaste for 3 months and so far it is the best stuff I have  ever had! And it's not even more expensive than other brands, simply because it's concentrated as well as most of Amway products. Recommended dose is 1/2 to 1/3 of regular dose of other toothpastes, just on the tip of your brush. Actually, in my family we are 3 people and one tube lasted little longer than 2 months (we use to brush teeth twice a day each) I'm nonsmoker but I have a friend who smokes quite a lot and he did removed nicotine stains from his teeth after less than 1 week of using Glister. The other good thing is that it doesn't change the taste of food if you eat after you brush your teeth (however, it's still better if you do it after you have eaten :-), but it happens sometimes... The only little disadvantage is that you can't buy it in the store and you have to find Amway dealer. But than you will find many more products to satisfy your needs.
And what’s more......the New Glister Multi-Action Toothpaste has been tested and certified by a leading oral health institute in the USA.
dr. sajan
I would strongly recommend this to anyone to try it out for at least one month with open mind.
Try some today!  You'll never regret it.

This is the best toothpaste I have ever used. It gives cleaner, whiter and healthier teeth. It is the only toothpaste containing the patented polishing agent LS-928 which allows for effective polishing without excessive abrasion of tooth enamel. It removes various kind of stains like tobacco, tea and coffee, makes your teeth brighter and whiter. Prevents cavities. It helps to remove Plaque.  The cool mint taste of glister toothpaste is liked by kids and adults. Every one in my family uses glister. It last longer than any other brand of toothpaste almost 2.5 to 3 times. so It is price competitive.

Amway has changed the abrasive in Glister from LS-928 to Sylodent, a silica abrasive.  I am unaware how the Sylodent abrasive compares to other silica abrasive.  Amway also changed Glister's product label from ''anti-plaque'' to ''multi-action'', although besides the new abrasive,  the toothpaste formula contains ingredients found in all other common toothpastes: fluoride, SLS, sweetener, flavor.
I would definetly recommend the brand for its long term benefits inspite of the price.
So, I don't recommend this product and advice to use any other toothpaste instead of glister.

Hi there, I personally feel its a strong  toothpaste to be used continuously for a long period of time as it is 100% herbal with one of its main ingredients being clove. It definitely gives one a clean feel when used for the first time but over a period of time if used daily it tends to rip the enamel of the teeth and makes the gums feel sore, Which means its not very good for people with sensitivity. Though it smells good and leaves a lasting freshness for the first few uses,  using it for a long period of time might cause discomfort. therefore, I would suggest its used occasionally when you feel a desperate need to cleanse thoroughly.  Its priced at Rs.75/- for a 200g tube.  The tube is made of soft bendable plastic material easy to squeeze  out the required amount.  Overall a good product if you have strong teeth and just need cleansing.
review_tite: Good toothpaste to be used occasionally.
